news.title: An avoidable crisis: Is India’s affordable housing segment facing an IndiGo-style fiasco?
news.para: The affordable housing market in India faces a serious challenge as developers pivot towards upscale projects, creating a void in accessible housing options for the masses. This situation echoes the difficulties faced by IndiGo in its earlier operational phases.

news.title: Blackstone-backed Horizon Industrial Parks files DRHP for ₹2,600-crore IPO
news.para: Horizon Industrial Parks, with the financial muscle of Blackstone, is gearing up to enter the public market with an Initial Public Offering aimed at raising around ₹2,600 crore. This momentum follows a successful pre-IPO raising of nearly ₹1,650 crore.

news.title: Office vacancy levels likely to hit historic lows by FY27 as demand outpaces supply: ICRA
news.para: India's office landscape is on the brink of a transformation. By FY2027, vacancy rates are anticipated to plunge to their lowest levels in several years. The demand for leasing is outpacing new developments, fueled by the rise of global capability centers, flexible workspace providers, and the booming BFSI industry.

news.title: InvITs, REITs distributions jump over 55% year-on-year in Q2 FY26: ICRA
news.para: Indian Infrastructure Investment Trusts and Real Estate Investment Trusts saw significant distribution growth in the second quarter of fiscal year 2026. This surge was driven by robust performance in sectors like roads, power, commercial real estate, and logistics.

news.title: REIT market in India crosses ₹2.3 lakh crore in asset value
news.para: India’s REIT market has grown into a mainstream asset class, with asset value of about ₹2.3 lakh crore and market capitalisation of nearly ₹1.66 lakh crore, surpassing Hong Kong. Supported by high occupancies, stable yields and strong returns, the sector is set for further growth as Sebi’s equity reclassification from 2026 is expected to broaden investor participation.

news.title: India’s retail real estate to attract $3.5 billion investments over next three years
news.para: The future of India's retail real estate looks promising, with an estimated $3.5 billion in investments expected in the coming three years. As challenges mount for shopping centers in the West, international investors are turning their eyes to India.

news.title: Patna civic body resolves 671 property tax, waste charge complaints in a month
news.para: Patna Municipal Corporation has resolved 671 property tax and solid waste charge complaints out of 1,782 registered grievances. This marks a significant step in citizen-centric governance. The civic body is prioritizing swift disposal of complaints. Municipal commissioner Yashpal Meena emphasized prompt handling to provide timely relief to residents. Remaining cases are under active processing.

news.title: Gurugram high-rises advised to install smog guns to cut dust pollution
news.para: Gurugram's air quality remains in the very poor bracket, prompting the Haryana State Pollution Control Board to advise residential and commercial projects to install smog guns or water-sprinkling systems. Over 180 projects received the advisory, which suggests using treated water and operating systems during critical AQI levels and low wind speeds.

news.title: Goa: Three lakh sq meter of private forest turned into settlement at Arambol
news.para: Arambol residents are protesting the conversion of a 3 lakh sqm private forest hill into settlement land, fearing landslides and water scarcity. Despite assurances from the Chief Minister and local MLA, a notification was issued this month, sparking outrage over potential luxury developments and the destruction of local wildlife habitats and cultural sites.

news.title: Allottees flag design gaps in Bengaluru’s Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Layout, demand basic amenities
news.para: Allottees at Bengaluru's Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Layout are raising alarms over critical infrastructure gaps, including missing footpaths and incomplete roads, hindering habitation. Despite accelerated development, residents point to flawed planning and a lack of basic amenities like electricity and water. They urge BDA to revise designs with mobility experts to prevent future urban planning blunders.

news.title: Panel formed for changes in Gujarat land revenue act
news.para: A committee led by retired IAS officer C L Meena has been formed by the Gujarat government to review the Gujarat Land Revenue Act, 1879. The panel, including other retired IAS officers, will examine existing rules and resolutions, considering judicial interpretations and representations from various organizations. They are tasked with recommending necessary amendments to the Act within six months.

news.title: Karnataka RERA raps builder, orders refund with interest
news.para: Bengaluru homebuyer secured relief from K-RERA after builders failed to deliver possession even after executing two agreements, prompting the Authority to order refund with interest and permit recovery action

news.title: IGR office follows up with Maharashtra's IT department to restore Aadhaar verification service
news.para: Property registration services in Maharashtra are disrupted due to a technical glitch at the state's Department of Information Technology, impacting Aadhaar-based online verification. This has led to delays and forced citizens to visit sub-registrar offices in person, with online leave-and-licence and first-sale registrations also stalled.

news.title: Pending home sales in USA surge to highest in nearly three years in November: NAR
news.para: In a hopeful turn for prospective homeowners, November marked a significant resurgence in the real estate market of USA, with pending home sales hitting their highest levels in nearly three years. This uptick can be traced back to better affordability, driven by lower mortgage rates and increased wages.

news.title: Poor families to receive keys to their flats in New Year: Delhi CM
news.para: The Delhi Government is steadily moving forward with its resolve to provide not just a roof, but a dignified and well-facilitated life to citizens belonging to the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) of the capital, according to an official release.

news.title: Hong Kong expects higher private housing land supply as outlook brightens
news.para: Hong Kong's government forecasts that it will surpass its private housing land supply target by a striking 20%. This optimistic projection emerges from a renewed surge of confidence among developers, who are set to introduce two fresh residential sites.

news.title: Adani group to set up cement grinding unit at Guna
news.para: Adani Group is set to significantly expand its cement presence in Madhya Pradesh. Land has been secured in Guna for a new grinding unit, with an investment of Rs 1,500 crore. Plans are also moving forward for a second grinding unit in Ujjain, involving a Rs 1,400 crore outlay.
